title: Courgette & Herb Fritters – DF
name: Courgette & Herb Fritters
method: Salt the grated courgettes for 5 minutes, then squeeze firmly in a clean tea towel to remove as much liquid as possible.
Whisk the egg in a bowl. Stir in the flour and herbs, then fold through the courgette. Season well.
Heat a thin layer of oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat.
Spoon in 6–8 small fritters and flatten slightly. Cook 2–3 minutes per side until deep golden and cooked through.
Drain briefly on kitchen paper and serve immediately.
swaps: For higher protein: add 150 g low-fat cottage cheese or strained Greek yoghurt on the side (not dairy-free).
For gluten-free: use gluten-free plain flour; check labels.
hydrationTip: Have a glass of water before you eat, and another alongside this meal.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Beetroot & Lentil Bake – DF
name: Beetroot & Lentil Bake
method: In a saucepan, sauté the onion in 1 tsp olive oil over medium heat for 5 minutes until softened.
Add the garlic and cook 30 seconds, then stir in the diced beetroot.
Add the cooked lentils and 250 ml vegetable stock or passata. Season and add herbs.
Tip into a baking dish, cover with foil, and bake 25–30 minutes until the beetroot is tender.
Uncover for the final 5 minutes to reduce slightly, then serve.
swaps: For higher protein: stir through 200 g drained cannellini beans or serve with 150 g fat-free Greek yoghurt (not vegan).
For a vegan version: keep as is and add extra lentils/beans; top with toasted seeds.
hydrationTip: Have a glass of water before you eat, and another alongside this meal.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Golden Beet, Orange & Basil Salad – DF
name: Golden Beet, Orange & Basil Salad
method: Put the beetroot in a saucepan, cover with cold water, bring to the boil then simmer 20–35 minutes until a knife slides in easily.
Drain, cool until safe to handle, then slip off the skins and slice into rounds.
Whisk the orange juice (and zest if using) with olive oil, salt, pepper and a pinch of cinnamon.
Toss beetroot with the dressing, then finish with torn basil just before serving.
swaps: For higher protein: add 150 g cooked lentils, chickpeas, or 80 g crumbled feta (contains milk).
For extra fibre: add rocket and shaved fennel, or serve with a wholegrain roll.
hydrationTip: Have a glass of water before you eat, and another alongside this meal.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Kale Ribbon Salad with Chilli Oil – DF
name: Kale Ribbon Salad with Chilli Oil
method: Strip kale leaves from the stalks and slice into thin ribbons.
Add kale to a bowl with 1 tsp lemon juice and 1 tsp chilli oil. Massage for 60–90 seconds until darker and tender.
Drizzle over the remaining chilli oil, toss, then finish with sesame seeds.
swaps: For higher protein: add 2 boiled eggs (contains egg) or 150 g edamame (contains soy).
For a lower-fat option: use 2 tsp chilli oil total and add extra lemon for punch.
hydrationTip: Have a glass of water before you eat, and another alongside this meal.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.
